1.text: Remove any dried or browned leaves from your stalks.

2.text: Rinse your oregano under a stream of cool water.

3.text: Shake your herbs dry and blot them with a paper towel.

4.text: Gather your oregano into groups of 2-4 stalks and put them in a paper bag.

5.text: Wrap twine tightly around the stalks to secure them together.

6.text: Hang your stalks from a pole, hook, or clothing line with twine.

7.text: Wait 2-6 weeks for your oregano to dry.

8.text: Get a set of dehydrating trays with a protective screen.

9.text: Set your oregano out evenly in between the trays and stack them.

10.text: Leave the trays out in warm, well-ventilated area.

11.text: Wait at least 1 week for your oregano to dry out.

12.text: Arrange your oregano in single layers on your dehydrator’s trays.

14.text: Set the trays back inside of your dehydrator.

15.text: Let your oregano dry in the dehydrator for 1-4 hours.

17.text: Spread your oregano out on a clean, dry sheet pan.

18.text: Bake your oregano for 1 hour in the center rack of your oven.

19.text: Remove the tray and let your oregano cool for 10-20 minutes.
